intro: Galium hohuanshanense, commonly known as Hohuanshan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
